content.description: Stand at a crimp and follow more crimps to the top. This has really great rock quality and a nice topout.
Stand start matched on the high sloper-shelf. From there, make a few moves on good holds to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pad. The landing is perfect.
content.location: It climbs the center of Megalomania's north face.

content.description: Sit start matched on good edges with cramped footing. From there, crank up to a set of edges, and continue to the lip for an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pad will work fine. The landing is great.
content.location: It climbs the center of Megalomania's north face.

content.description: This is a short/fun climb on the north side of the Megalomania Boulder. Start on big jug at chest height and work a few small crimps to the top.
content.protection: A couple pads and a spotter should be enough protection.
content.location: This is on the north side of the Megalomania Boulder.

content.description: Sit start with your choice of hold. From there, follow the arete, staying on the east side, to an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pad or two. The landing is good, but there are some rocks near the fall zone towards the end.
content.location: It climbs the east side of Megalomania'a southeast arete.

content.description:
Sit start matched on the shelf. From there, crank up to the start of

Orangutang

, then follow the seam to the left. Once at

Ozymandias

, use the same finish.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is great throughout.
content.location: It climbs the north face of Megalomania.

content.description:
Endocrine Disruptor is a technical, vertical face climb that ascends perfect sandstone edges over an ideal landing.

Stand start from two micro-edges about five feet off the ground, a thin left foot edge, and a high right foot edge/tooth (crux).  From there, move up the vertical face/slab, using a two-finger pocket, and larger edges to reach a solid top out.

Achieving a high, right foot edge will help gain the initial two-finger pocket. This requires a fair amount of flexibility.
content.protection: Pad and a spot, great landing though.
content.location:
Find this on the South-face of Megalomania Block.  The problem lies in between

Cold Shower

and

Tea Time

.

content.description: Stand start with a left hand crimp and right hand sidepull.  Move up the slab/vertical face using sidepulls and crimps to a good topout.
content.location: This is the Easternmost line on the south-face of the Megalomania Block.

content.description: Stand start with a left hand on the arete and a right hand on an undercling. From there, achieve a high right foot edge, reach a left hand edge up high, then traverse right through an edge, reach the shelf/massive sidepull, then go straight up, and mantle atop the boulder.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work, the landing is perfect.
content.location: It climbs the west face slab of Megalomania.

content.description: Start at two jugs along the crack and follows the crack up and left. It has good rock for smearing to get through the bottom part and nice crimp holds near the top.  The rock directly behind you can make this more mentally difficult.
content.protection: Spotters and pads... falling would be a bad idea.
content.location: This is the last route at the end of the wall.

content.description:
Apneic ascends a blunt, overhanging arete that finishes up a dihedral slab.  The formation is unique for the canyon, the rock quality is outstanding, and the landing is very good.

Stand start with a left hand sidepull and a right hand sidepull with a thumb-catch at the arete, each are about five feet off the ground.  From there, slap the right hand up the arete, then bump that same hand again to a tooth on the arete (crux), gain the jugs, work the feet up high and negotiate the remaining dihedral slab (tree branches are off) to reach the topout.
content.protection: A few pads will do, the landing is very good, but there is a large tree just right of the arete that may come into play during an ascent.
content.location: This ascends the northeast arete of Megalomania Block.
